title: Crone Woods Walk Route

images.title: JP / Crone Wood Car Park
images.caption: Crone Wood Car Park. The woods were once part of the Powerscourt Estate with records from the 13th-century showing the area was set aside as a royal hunting ground. Use of the woods for cover during the 1798 Rebellion led to the creation of the military road through northern Wicklow Mountains with several barracks to open up the region. The forest is owned and operated by Coillte, the Irish state forestry agency.

images.title: JP / Waterfalls in a stream in Ballyreagh, Co. Wicklow
images.caption: Waterfalls in a stream in Ballyreagh, Co. Wicklow

images.title: Joe King, CC BY-SA 3.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: View of Powerscourt Deerpark and Waterfall at Ride Rock, Crone Woods near Enniskerry, County Wicklow, Ireland. At 121 metres, the waterfall is the tallest in Ireland. It is fed by the River Dargle which rises in the Glensoulan valley near Djouce mountain, which can be seen in background.

images.title: Powerscourt waterfall by Christopher Hilton, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Powerscourt waterfall

images.title: Britishfinance, CC BY-SA 4.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Crone Woods Map

description: These expansive woods are located in the Wicklow Mountains and include an extensive network of footpaths and mountain bike trails. The peaceful trails will lead you to pretty streams with photogenic waterfalls at the northern end of the site. At the eastern end of the woods you will find a car park where you can start your walk. The woods were part of the wider Powerscourt Estate where you can visit the picturesque Powerscourt Waterfall or enjoy a climb to the fine viewpoint at Maulin. This walk visits 'Ride Rock', where there are fabulous views down to the falls. The epic Wicklow Way also passes the eastern edge of the woods. You could pick up this waymarked trail to further explore the Wicklow Mountains.
